result.execSummary:
The defendant Tevin Demetrius Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

forwarded to Judge Siefert
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

AS TO COUNT 1
Court withheld sentence.  Court placed defendant on probation for 1 YEAR with the following conditions: 

-Pay remaining $184.00 balance on 13FO1390 during probation.
-Request expunction on case 09CF4046.
-AODA assessment. 
-Random drug screens.
-30 days condition time STAYED, to be used during probation for positive drug screens.
-Provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges by 9/2/2016 or a civil judgment will be entered.

**Court orders 2 year drivers license revocation lifted on cases 13TR26050, 13TR26051, and 13TR26052. Court ordered failure to pay penalty be changed to a civil judgment.

*ZERO days drivers license revocation.
*Court ordered defendant to get drivers license. 

**Court will grant expunction if all costs are paid in full.

Filed, 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Tevin Demetrius Johnson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, and Elements received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Defendant Tevin Demetrius Johnson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tevin Demetrius Johnson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-17-2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tevin Demetrius Johnson in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Tevin Demetrius Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
